name: 4-ethyl-2-methoxyphenol
Reason: The compound 4-ethyl-2-methoxyphenol has a melting point that can be predicted using the functional groups present in the molecule. The methoxy group (-O-CH3) is known to increase the melting point due to increased hydrogen bonding capability, typically by around 30-40°C. The ethyl group (-CH2CH3) adds bulkiness and steric hindrance, which can increase the melting point by approximately +20-30°C. The benzene ring has a melting point of 5.5°C. The presence of the carboxylic acid group can contribute to a decrease in melting point due to less symmetry and weaker intermolecular forces, like hydrogen bonding, which might decrease the melting point by approximately -20 to -40°C.
